SUNIL THOMAS, J.
Cri.M.C.Nos.5674 of 2015 and 4767 of 2016
Dated this the 4‚Äù day of August, 2016
COMMON ORDER

When the matters were taken up, learned counsel for
the second respondent submitted that the disputes between the
parties have been finally resolved amicably.

In the light of above, learned counsel for the petitioner
submitted that he does not propose to pursue the Crl.M.Cs. This is
recorded and Crl.M.Cs are dismissed as not pressed.

Sd/-
SUNIL THOMAS
